intro: Nananthus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. Nananthus species typically grow in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its hardiness and attractive blooms.
